source.bd832847:
SUPERVISED LEARNING

  • Supervised learning creates a model that makes predictions based on evidence.
  • Supervised learning algorithm, known for known input data a model to generate reasonable estimates of new data using responses creates.
  • The data to be used for the output you are trying to guess is controlled learning is preferred.
  • Classification and regression to develop prediction models use techniques.

Classification

  • Classification is preferred if data can be tagged or separated into specific groups It may be.
  • For example, handwriting recognition applications can It uses.

Commonly used algorithms:

  • Support vector machine (SVM)
  • Decision trees (DT)
  • k-Nearest neighbor (kNN)
  • Naïve Bayes
  • Neural networks

Regression

  • Regression techniques, temperature changes or power demand predicts continuous reactions such as fluctuations.
  • When working with a data range or expected response is a real number, such as the time until the temperature or the failure of an equipment.
  • Regression techniques may be preferred.

source.34729240:
UNSUPERVISED LEARNING

  • Unsupervised learning finds hidden patterns or internal structures in the data.
  • To make inferences from input data without labeled responses used.
  • Clustering is the most widely used unsupervised learning technique.

Example applications:

  • Analysis of the gene sequence,
  • the market research,
  • object recognition etc.
source.766f24b4:
Data Preprocessing

Problems

The data we encounter in real life, often referred to as floating-point values, may be missing or incomplete, noisy and inconsistent.This reduces data quality.

Reasons that reduce data quality:

  • Noise
  • Outliers
  • Missing Values
  • Duplicate Data
  • Mismatch in data naming or structure

Missing: Some attribute values may not be entered for some objects.

  • profession = ""

Noisy: Can contain incorrect records.

  • Age= "150"

Inconsistent: Attribute values or attribute names are incompatible.

  • age = "35" instead of date = "05/05/1955"
  • Male / Female instead of 0/1
  • The attribute value can be "name" and a different value.

Missing Value

  • Failure to collect information
  • Improper qualifications
  • Duplicate Data

Why data preprocessing?

  • Low quality data leads to low success.
source.37f6cd2a:
Data

Description: Machine Learning, the development of computer programs that can learn from data Purposes.

Example: Iris flower species in one machine Can you distinguish ?

Data: (Lat. Datum; ç. Data) is the raw (unprocessed) real information thread.

  • The data are obtained by measurement, counting, experiment, observation or research.It refers to a fact used in computer science for data, calculation or manipulation.Machine Learning is a set of data, objects and objects.
  • Instead of object, record, asset, instance can be used.
  • The attribute is a feature of an object (age) of a person's age, the temperature of the environment.
  • Dimension, size, feature can be used
  • Attributes and values of these attributes form an object.Objects group creates data
  • Customer, Employee, Student etc

Types of Attributes

  • Discrete Attribute
    • Properties with finite numbers
    • words in a postal code, profession, or document set
    • Can be expressed as integer values
    • Binary attributes are also a special type of discrete attributes
  • Continuous Attribute
    • Qualities whose value is real numbers
    • temperature, height, weight
    • Floating-point values can be expressed as
source.e8ccd724:
Data Cleaning

Missing data completion

  • Ignore registration
  • Manual filling
  • Filling global values
  • Filling with attribute average
  • Filling the missing data with the average of the group to which the missing data belongs
  • Filling with the most likely value (Regression, Bayesian, Inference)

Noisy Data: Error at a measured value.

Reasons:

  • Incorrect attribute values
  • data collection equipment
  • data entry problems
  • data transmission problems
  • technological constraints discrepancy

source.9a9321f1:
WHAT IS A MACHINE LEARNING?

Hello to everyone, Before starting the machine learning training for beginners, various definitions are needed. These needs are very helpful for people on future issues.

Computer is an electronic machine that can perform the logical and arithmetic operations with the data it receives from the user, store the results and reach this information on demand.

Program is a set of commands created using any programming language to solve a problem.

Algorithm is a series of steps designed to reveal all the steps necessary to solve a problem in an abstract and meaningful way.

Machine Learning (ML) or Artificial Learning is the science of ensuring that computers operate without explicit programming.Machine Learning aims to develop computer programs that can learn from data.Machine Learning is so common nowadays that you probably use it dozens of times a day without knowing it.Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence (AI) should not be confused.AI includes Machine Learning, but Machine Learning does not fully define AI.

Machine learning over the past decade

  • autonomous vehicles (self-acting) ,
  • speech recognition ,
  • effective web search ,
  • better understanding of the human genome.

In recent years, with the development of information technologies, machine learning has gained momentum.

  • Machine Learning uses statistics.
  • However, machine learning is not statistics.

Naive Bayes

What is Learning Concept?

  • Boolean (True or False) function extraction from a set of pre-defined training data sets.

Sample
